title: Ticket #5341: When cgroup OOM killer holds job, no final update or file xfer happens
description: When cgroups are enabled, and a job exceeds the memory limits, the per-cgroup OOM killer fires, and the starter puts the job on hold. However, it doesn't do a final job ad update, so the memory and cpu usage information are not up to date, and it looks like the job shouldn't have been OOM-killed. Also, file xfer doesn't happen if ON_EXIT_OR_EVICT is set, so releasing the job with a larger request_memory will cause self-checkpointing jobs to start from scratch.
